intro: Solenanthus nigricans var. hispidus, commonly known as the hairy solenanthus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Melanthiaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
